nodes.documentation:
Contract Features
Generic contract that allows every contract on the blockchain to define which features it supports.
Other contracts can query this contract to find out whether a given contract on the
blockchain supports a certain feature.
Each contract type can define its own list of feature flags.
Features can be only enabled/disabled by the contract they are defined for.
Features should be defined by each contract type as bit flags, e.g. -
uint256 public constant FEATURE1 = 1 << 0;
uint256 public constant FEATURE2 = 1 << 1;
uint256 public constant FEATURE3 = 1 << 2;
...
nodes.name: ContractFeatures
isSupported
enableFeatures

Contract Features
Generic contract that allows every contract on the blockchain to define which features it supports.
Other contracts can query this contract to find out whether a given contract on the
blockchain supports a certain feature.
Each contract type can define its own list of feature flags.
Features can be only enabled/disabled by the contract they are defined for.
Features should be defined by each contract type as bit flags, e.g. -
uint256 public constant FEATURE1 = 1 << 0;
uint256 public constant FEATURE2 = 1 << 1;
uint256 public constant FEATURE3 = 1 << 2;
...
nodes.name: ContractFeatures
isSupported
enableFeatures

enableFeatures(uint256,bool).details: allows a contract to enable/disable certain feature(s)

params._enable: true to enable the feature(s), false to disabled them

isSupported(address,uint256).details: returns true if a given contract supports the given feature(s), false if not

params._contract: contract address to check support for

isSupported(address,uint256).return: true if the contract supports the feature(s), false if not
